City of Bellevue Police Department

communications.subject: [Records Center] Police Records Request :: P000137-010923
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line. Anything below will not be viewable to staff. --- 

01/18/2023 
Rose Terse, 
I am writing to update you on the status of your public disclosure request submitted to the Bellevue Police Department. 
Your request is still considered open. We anticipated being able to provide you with responsive records by the end of business on this date, but due to the volume of open requests and the availability of staff, we have been unable to do so. You should anticipate an additional response by the end of business on 1/26/2023, if not sooner. 
If you have any questions regarding your disclosure request or any other matter, please contact the Bellevue Police Department Records Unit via the Public Records Portal or by telephone at (425) 452-6917. 
Thank you for your patience, 
Emma Fierro 
Bellevue Police Department

communications.subject: [Records Center] Police Records Request :: P000137-010923
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line. Anything below will not be viewable to staff. --- 

01/26/2023 
Rose Terse, 
Information responsive to your request for public records is now available via the City of Bellevue Public Records Portal website. Pop-ups may need to be enabled on your internet browser to access your files for download . This concludes our search of records in the custody of the Bellevue Police Department. Your request is now closed; we have nothing additionally responsive to this request. 

Pursuant to the Public Records Act RCW 42.56, responsive records may be redacted or exempt. Please review the accompanying privilege log for further information, if such redactions or exemptions have been applied. 
Per the State Public Records Act (RCW 42.56.120) and City Public Records Act Rules (Section 6), a public records request may be considered abandoned and subsequently closed if a requestor fails to fulfill their obligation to claim an installment of records; claim the entire production of records; inspect the records; or fails to pay the deposit or final payment for requested records within 30 days of this notification. 
If you believe the information furnished has been incorrectly redacted or is incomplete, you may file a written appeal. The appeal must include your name and address, a copy of the redacted document and a copy of this letter together with a brief statement identifying the basis of the appeal. Please mail your appeal to: 
Bellevue Police Department 
Attn: Records Supervisor 
P.O. Box 90012 
Bellevue, WA  98009-9012 
Thank you, 
Emma Fierro 
Bellevue Police Department RPC 4.4 Inadvertent Disclosure Notification: CR 26 (b) (6) Claw Back Provision *** Please read this notice carefully *** 
Dear legal practitioner: Please take notice that we take reasonable precautions to prevent the disclosure of privileged or confidential materials, including those protected by the attorney-client privilege and/or work product doctrine, when responding to request for records.  These precautions include, but are not limited to, carefully locating and assembling responsive records, performing an intra-departmental review of the records for purposes of determining whether they contain any privileged or confidential materials, forwarding the records to the County Prosecuting Attorney's Office for independent legal review, meeting and conferring with the Prosecuting Attorney's Office to compare and reconcile any conflicting results of our separate independent reviews and, if necessary, creating a withholding log.  Despite our having taken these precautions, occasionally a mistake is made and privileged or confidential documents are inadvertently produced.  To that end, we wanted to notify you that there is a possibility that the records being produced may contain privileged or confidential materials.  The inadvertent or unintentional production of privileged or confidential documents, without a privileged or confidentiality designation should not be considered a waiver in whole or in part of any claim of privileged or confidential treatment, and any document that initially is produced without bearing a privileged or confidentiality designation may later be so designated.  In the event that you believe you have received privileged or confidential materials, we would ask that you promptly notify us of this fact and take action as necessary to comply with the obligations set forth in Rule of Professional Conduct 4.4 and/or Civil Rule 26 (b)(6).

title: North Carolina Freedom of Information Act. Request: North Carolina Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Appalachian State university)

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: North Carolina Freedom of Information Act. Request: North Carolina Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Appalachian State university)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { North Carolina Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

communications.subject: Your first record request #23-9 has been opened.
communications.communication:
Appalachian State University ************************************************************************ Your first Appalachian State University record request (request number #23-9) has been submitted. It is currently unpublished and is not available for the general public to view. Appalachian State University has received your request for public records. Please note that we review each request in the order in which it is received and determine whether any records exist that are responsive to your request. Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Act, the university does not create new records in order to fulfill requests for public records. In regards to information pertaining to students, the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) requires the university to protect student education records. Student email addresses, phone numbers and physical addresses are not public records, under University Policy 105.2, and therefore, will not be disclosed. Appalachian State University's Public Records policy is available online at https://click.pstmrk.it/2tm/policy.appstate.edu%2FPublic_Records_Requests./8vsyKDcN/DbEk/WfpkJt5XeF/cmVxdWVzdGVyX3JlcXVlc3Rfb3BlbmVk Feel free to contact us if you have any questions. Thank you.   The Public Records Team Appalachian State University     The due date for your request may be later than usual because the office is closed on: * February 20: Presidents' Day * May 29: Memorial Day Request #23-9. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Clover Park School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by Clover Park School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.

In the event the District chooses to provide these records in installments over time I request the records to be produced in reverse chronological order - from the most recent records to the earliest.

If this request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the PRA. I also request a detailed contemporaneous log to be provided for any document withheld or redacted.

For each responsive record the District contends is exempt from public disclosure, in whole or in part, please specifically identify the record by subject, title, author, custodian and date, and state how a specific statutory exemption applies to each record as required by RCW 42.56.210(3) and Rental Housing Ass'n v. Des Moines, 165 Wn.2d 525, 199 P.3d 393 (2009).

I request electronic production of all electronic records in the original NATIVE electronic format for each record. 

I request for these public records to be produced by public (no password) e-mail attachment or link. If electronic attachment or link is not possible, an alternative would be to produce responsive records via USB DRIVE or DATA CD-ROM.

THIS REQUEST IS NOT BEING MADE FOR COMMERCIAL PURPOSES.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

PRA Audit

communications.subject: Re: Washington Public Records Act Request: Clover Park School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021
communications.communication:
Dear PRA Audit,



The Clover Park School District received your public records request on November 5, 2021. Your request seeks all public records requests received by the District from January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021, as well as a complete electronic copy of the District’s responses to those requests.



You have requested “electronic production of all electronic records in the original NATIVE format for each record.” The vast majority of records the District has disclosed in response to public records requests since 2010 have not been produced in native format, and instead were produced in formats such as .pdf. And as noted earlier, you have requested “a complete electronic copy of the District’s Responses” to public records requests during the time period in question, and such responses typically did not contain native format records. In light of this conflict, the District interprets your request as seeking the District’s previous disclosure communications in their native format, recognizing that those disclosure communications will often contain non-native files. For example, the District would produce to you the native format email of its response to a given public records request, which may include attached responsive records in pdf format that were actually produced to a requestor. Please let me know if you disagree with this interpretation of your request.



Next, please be aware that the District may no longer possess copies of older public records requests and/or District responses. In that event, the District would be unable to disclose copies of such requests and responses.



Per District Procedure 4040P and RCW 42.56.120, the District charges the following fees for electronic copies of records:



1.     Ten cents per page for public records scanned into an electronic format or for the use of district equipment to scan the records;

2.     Five cents per each four electronic files or attachments uploaded to email, cloud-based data storage service, or other means of electronic delivery;

3.     Ten cents per gigabyte for the transmission of public records in an electronic format or for the use of district equipment to send the records electronically; and

4.     The actual cost of any digital storage media or device provided by the district, the actual cost of any container or envelope used to mail the copies to the requestor, and the actual postage or delivery charge.



Any applicable copying costs must be received by the District before the District discloses records. Additionally, District Procedure 4040P and RCW 42.56.120 authorize the District to require a deposit of up to ten percent of the total estimated costs of providing copies for a request. The District has not yet had an opportunity to determine how many responsive records there will be, or what the total estimated cost of fulfilling the request will be. Prior to providing the first installment of records for this request, we will contact you to let you know the total estimated cost and the deposit amount due. Following receipt of the deposit, the District will require payment of any applicable copying costs before producing installments.



At this time, the District estimates that it will be able to disclose an initial installment of records by February 4, 2022. I have also submitted your request to our NextRequest Program on November 5, 2021, at 3:29 pm. This will also include our 5-day response from our District.


Thank you.



Aranka Holmes

Coordinator for Public Records, WC Claims, and ADA

[cid:b525986e-eb5d-4ccc-9e3e-be0e3be9d7ee]

Creating Promising Futures.



Student Services Center

10903 Gravelly Lake Dr SW, Lakewood WA  98499-1341

253-583-5083 •  Fax 253-583-5088

If you are not an intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any use, dissemination, distribution, disclosure, or copying of this information is unauthorized and strictly prohibited. communications.subject: [External Message Added] Clover Park School District public records request #21-119
communications.communication:
Clover Park School District ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #21-119: Hello,   The District is currently processing your request and will have the first installment produced to you on February 15, 2022.   I am writing for clarification regarding you request for a “complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by Clover Park School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010, through November 4, 2021.” As background, the District processes requests for records under the Public Records Act (PRA), Chapter 42.56 RCW and requests for records under the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), 34 C.F.R 99, within the same program. FERPA provides families certain rights with regard to their students’ education records, including the ability to review and request their student’s education records. See 34 C.F.R. 99.10. Because the District processes both PRA requests and FERPA requests through the same system, many requests by parents to view their student records have been labelled PRA requests, when in actuality, they were FERPA requests. This means many of the sets of records that appear to have been produced under the PRA were actually produced under FERPA. For example, the first installment to you of responsive records will include about eighty requests for records. Of those 80 requests, 30 sets of records were requested under FERPA, while the rest were requested under the PRA.   The District would like you to clarify whether you are seeking those requests for records which would qualify as FERPA requests, or if you are purely seeking the records produced under the PRA.   The information you requested is unable to be emailed due to size; however, we have copied the requested items onto a flash drive. The cost of the flash drive is as follows:            Thumb/CD drive         $6.00            Postage                           .50           Shipping container      $1.00                                               $7.50   In the event you wish to pick up the thumb drive, you would just be charged for the thumb drive. Otherwise, we will mail the contents to you once payment is received. We accept either cash (needs to be exact change) or check (made payable to Clover Park School District). Please contact me at aholmes@cloverpark.k12.wa.us if you have any questions.   This is the District’s final notice that if you do not provide clarification on these requests, the District will close your request on March 15, 2022. RCW 42.46.520(3)(b); WAC 44-14-04003(8).   Thanks,     Aranka Holmes Human Resources Coordinator for Public Records, WC Claims, and ADA Creating Promising Futures.   Student Services Center 10903 Gravelly Lake Dr SW, Lakewood WA 98499-1341 253-583-5083 • Fax 253-583-5088   IMPORTANT NOTICE: This e-mail message and all attachments, if any, may contain confidential and privileged material and are intended only for the person or entity to which the message is addressed. Clover Park School District ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #21-119: Hello, MuckRock, On November 05, 2021, Clover Park School District received your request for public records. This letter serves as the district’s initial response under RCW 42.56.520. You have requested the following: Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records: I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by Clover Park School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010, through November 4, 2021. This is the final installment of records. The information you requested is unable to be emailed due to size; however, we have copied the requested items onto a flash drive. The cost of the flash drive is as follows:            Thumb/CD drive         $6.00            Postage                          .50            Shipping container      $1.00                                               $7.50 In the event you wish to pick up the thumb drive, you would just be charged for the thumb drive. Otherwise, we will mail the contents to you once payment is received. We accept either cash (needs to be exact change) or checks (made payable to Clover Park School District). Please contact me at: aholmes@cloverpark.k12.wa.us if you have any questions. This is the district’s notice that if you do not provide payment by September 30, 2022, the District will close your request on October 01, 2022. RCW 42.46.523 With this final installment, the district has provided you with the records responsive to your request. Please note that in accordance with the Washington Secretary of State Retention Schedule, the District is not required to retain “records created in the activity of responding to public records requests in accordance with the Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW)” for more than two years, with limited exceptions. I have included the Washington State Government General Records Retention Schedule, Version 6.2 (August 2021) with this response for your review. See Section 5.4, Public Disclosure/Records Request, Disposition Authority Number GS 05001 Rev. 2, at pg. 114. You have requested Public Records Requests and Responses dating back to 2010. Consistent with the applicable retention schedule, the district does not have Public Records Requests and Responses dating back that far and have now provided you the records responsive to your request. title: Wisconsin Freedom of Information Act. Request: Wisconsin Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University of Wisconsin - La Crosse)

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Wisconsin Freedom of Information Act. Request: Wisconsin Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University of Wisconsin - La Crosse)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Wisconsin Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

title: FOIA - #JusticeforFloyd (Oakland Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: FOIA - #JusticeforFloyd (Oakland Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All internal notes, memos, bulletins, and emails created and/or received from 5/26/2020 to 5/30/2020 containing/mentioning any of the following terms:

- Protest
- Protests
- #ICantBreathe
- Icantbreathe
- I Can't Breathe
- George Floyd
- #GeorgeFloyd
- Derek Chauvin
- #DerekChauvin
- #JusticeforFloyd
- Justice for Floyd
- #JusticeforGeorge
- #GeorgeFloydProtests
- #BlackLivesMatter
- Black Lives Matte

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

communications.subject: 11/5 Pre-Proposal Meeting on Objective Design Standards RFP
communications.communication:
**DESIGN STANDARDS UPDATE:**

Pre-Proposal Meeting for Objective Design Standards & Streamlined
Project Review RFP
Friday, Nov. 5, 2021, 2:30 pm PST

The City of Oakland invites all qualified consultants to a Pre-Proposal
Meeting on Friday, November 5, 2021 at 2:30pm to discuss the recently
released Request for Proposals (RFP) to create objective design
standards and project review streamlining. This is an opportunity to
review the project goals and ask any questions about the RFP. 

The pre-proposal meeting will be held remotely over Zoom. Please follow
this Link

to join the Zoom meeting. Meeting ID: 867 0878 5553
Passcode: 210937 or

Dial by your location:
+1 669 900 6833 US (San Jose) +1 408 638 0968 US (San Jose)
+1 346 248 7799 US (Houston) +1 253 215 8782 US (Tacoma)
+1 312 626 6799 US (Chicago) +1 646 876 9923 US (New York)
+1 301 715 8592 US (Washington DC)

Background:
The City of Oakland received a grant from the Building Homes and Jobs
Act (SB-2) to prepare and implement policies that will expedite housing
development and increase local housing supply. This grant will help the
City to:

* Develop regulations or procedures to expedite approvals for a
significant portion of development proposals. This includes a separate,
non-discretionary permit review of projects that are consistent with the
City of Oakland's General Plan and Planning Code.

* Prepare Objective Design Standards to streamline processing for a
variety of proposals, especially affordable housing and projects near
BART and along major transit corridors.

The objective design standards will be applied broadly to projects
consisting of a wide array of building types throughout the City of
Oakland. Creation of the objective design standards for
non-housing-related projects will come from a separate funding source.

The desired consultant team will include one or more multi-disciplinary
planning and design firm(s) with expertise in the following areas:
developing objective design standards in ethnically, linguistically and
culturally diverse communities; creating programs and processes that
expedite project review; practicing historic preservation planning; and
engaging the local community and stakeholders in a participatory
planning process.    

Please visit Objective Design Standards website
for more
information about the RFP and the project.

DEADLINE FOR SUBMISSIONS:
   Friday, November 19, 2021 by 2:00 pm PST via iSupplier

NOTE: Interested consultants must Register with iSupplier
(the City
of Oakland's procurement portal) to submit a proposal. 

Interested in partnership opportunities?
Fill out our Expression of Interest form

to be identified as a firm interested in collaborating with other
firm(s) and to download the RFP. The City of Oakland will share, on a
rolling basis, a list of firms that express interest in the RFP to help
facilitate opportunities for possible partnerships. 

Have questions?
* Questions regarding this RFP should be directed to Ruslan Filipau,
General Plan Update Project Manager via email at ODS@oaklandca.gov

* Questions regarding iSupplier can be directed to
isupplier@oaklandca.gov , attention
Jasmine Chan

title: DYS house arrest policy

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: DYS house arrest policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any Department of Youth Services regulation, policy, procedure, or rule that defines, explains or mentions 'house arrest' or 'home confinement' for a youth on a Grant of Conditional Release, including how it is defined, when and how it can be used, who can use it, what it entails, how it can be enforced and how youth are informed, notified or educated of the existence of such regulation, policy, procedure, or rule and its meaning and the circumstances in which it can be applied.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Betsey Chace

title: NARA Congressional records policies

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NARA Congressional records policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All policies, procedures, instructions, manuals, guides, or other written material that relate to or mention NARA's collection Congressional Records at the conclusion of a session of Congress.
This request does not seek actual congressional records, only NARA's policies in relation to its activities to collect such records. 

Andrew Block 
America First Legal

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

AFL

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Wisconsin Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }
